channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Callcott, 2nd September
item.description:
So much litter

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Callcott Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Un approved closure, 2nd September
item.description:
There are no confirmed and approved road works that should still be happening on the A12 southbound, on the slip road leading up to the Brook Street roundabout (M25 junction) this left hand lane on the slip road has been closed for months, no workers actually in that lane and it’s been causing huge delays for months. There is no reason for the cones to still be blocking the left hand lane off and for it to still be closed. As confirmed, there are no approved lane closures still in action for this lane as the confirmation expired at the end of August. so the cones need to be removed and the lane finally opened as it is not approved to keep it closed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colchester Road, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked pipes., 2nd September
item.description:
In the lane behind Eastry Avenue, ditches run all the way along the back of the houses. Debris, leaves, large bits of old tree have fallen in. One of the pipes (see picture) is partially showing the water will not filter through and causes a flooding hazard! All the ditches need clearing out properly and all the drainage cleaned. . The little lane that goes up from Eastry Avenue to the lane needs regular sweeping/clearing I’ve reported this a few times with no regular cleaning put in place. With autumn approaching this will become even worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastry Avenue, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Church Row, on central island middle of the road, in front of nr 21, 2nd September
item.description:
The smaller tree in the central island was hit by a scaffolding truck today Sept 2, around 1. 3p pm. The tree truck is badly damaged, and the tree will fall if there is wind, posing a danger. The truck was owned by Fawkham Valley Scaffolding, tel. 01474 335821
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Church Row, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
